Package anydev

Class Table

java.lang.Object
anydev.Table
public class Table extends Object
Defines a data-table, either from an input source or for an output (to ease setup from within the model)
Since:
v1.0.0

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static Table.Builder create(String name)
      Start the creation of a new Table object with the given name. This replaces the previous 'named()' method and is the first step in the Builder pattern.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the table. Must be lower-case and no spaces.
      Returns:
      A new Builder instance, ready for column definitions.
      Throws:
      SanityCheckException - if name is not database-ready (assuming SanityCheck class exists)

    • addRow

      public void addRow(Row row)
      Adds given row to the end of this table
      Parameters:
      row - the data-row to be added
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - if columns do not match

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      name of the DB table (will be database-compatible)

    • getColumns

      public LinkedList<Column> getColumns()
      Returns:
      sequential list of all columns defined for this table (1st entry -> left-most column, last entry -> right-most)

    • getColumn

      public Column getColumn(String colName)
      Parameters:
      colName - name to find column for
      Returns:
      column with given name, null if none found

    • getColumn

      public Column getColumn(int colIndex)
      Parameters:
      colIndex - index to find column for. Use 0 for "left-most" column (the one defined first)
      Returns:
      column with given index
      Throws:
      SanityCheckException - if index>numColumns

    • getData

      public LinkedList<Row> getData()
      Returns:
      sequential list of data-rows stored in this table. First entry is "oldest" (or "highest up" in a table)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
